title: How to Make Mint Vinegar

steps.headline: Push in as many mint leaves into a clean bottle as possible.
Heat the white vinegar in a small saucepan.
steps.description: There should be enough to fill the bottle.

steps.headline: Pour the hot vinegar into the bottle.
steps.description: Use a funnel so that you don't spill hot vinegar over you.

steps.headline: Cap the bottle and leave it to set for 6 weeks.
steps.description: The mint flavour will diffuse through the vinegar during this time.

text: Push in as many mint leaves into a clean bottle as possible.  Heat the white vinegar in a small saucepan. There should be enough to fill the bottle. Pour the hot vinegar into the bottle. Use a funnel so that you don't spill hot vinegar over you. Cap the bottle and leave it to set for 6 weeks. The mint flavour will diffuse through the vinegar during this time. Serve. Strain prior to use. Finished.
